outputs.output_descr: The Orange-Senqu River Basin is a transboundary project that aims to improve transboundary water resources through ecosystem based Integrated Water Resource Management (IWRM) approaches that remediate threats and root causes. The participating countries are Botswana, Lesotho and South Africa. ORASECOM was founded in 2000; a permanent Secretariat and several task teams were established in 2007. The ORASECOM Secretariat coordinates and integrates all ICP supported projects. It is envisaged to integrate their work into a basin-wide Integrated Water Resource Management ( IWRM) Plan.

project_descr: The Project will assist riparian states to 1) identify principal threats to water resources of the Orange-Senqu R T/boundary Basin 2) devlp and implmnt a sustanble policy, legal & institonal reforms to address these threats. The Proj will create synergie
